dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: You were the middleman, am I right? Old man Christian wasn't about to go shopping for a snuff film himself.

dialogue.speaker: LONGDALE
dialogue.text: Wouldn't exactly have been possible for a man of his stature.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: So, he sent you, gave you the money, his errand-boy.  And if you refused, it wasn't like you could tell anyone your pervert boss just asked you to get him a snuff film.  That's the beauty of lawyer/client privilege.

dialogue.speaker: LONGDALE
dialogue.text: That's trust.  Mr. Christian trusted me implicitly.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Must have paid you a lot, for you to risk everything.  Would've had to have cut yourself a real nice piece of money.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: That's why you got scared when Mrs. Christian hired me.  You knew about the film, figured it had to be in that safe.  How'd you find me?

dialogue.speaker: LONGDALE
dialogue.text: Never mind how I found you.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Followed me... must have freaked out when you saw me closing in on your buddies...

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Except, you're willing commit murder with them.

dialogue.speaker: LONGDALE
dialogue.text: None of this would be happening if you would have left it alone.  If you weren't digging up a girl who died six years ago.  A girl no one even remembers.

dialogue.speaker: WELLES
dialogue.text: Mary Anne Mathews, that was her name.  Her mom remembers her.
